article.headline: Gold settles at record to close out week, notches best monthly gain since 2016
article.body: An earlier version of this article stated incorrect historical data for gold's monthly and weekly performances. Gold prices on Friday marked their best monthly return since February of 2016 and the best weekly advance since last week. Gold futures on Friday finished at a record and notched gains for the month and week as appetite for bullion persisted as concerns grew about the outlook for the economy and the market amid the COVID-19 pandemic. December gold GCZ20, +2.17% GC00, +2.17%, which is now the most-active contract, settled at $1,985.90 an ounce Friday, up 1%, or $19.10. For the month, gold climbed by about 10.3%, marking its best month since February of 2016, while it also notched a nearly 4.8% weekly gain, representing the best weekly gain since last week, according to Dow Jones Market Data.
